status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
The new UI provides the functional match of the 2 dialogs in the keypair landing page.

- create new keypair
- import public key
- delete keypair
fields.summary: Functional Match of 3 Dialogs on Keypair Landing Page

comments.body: Waiting on the wireframe for the create/import keypair page.

[~kyolee] wireframes are on confluence in the old locations (under key pairs). It is the same functionality as the old wireframes so i am not creating new ones for everything,  for new styling examples exist in confluence (under instances) and in the code. Let me know what you are confused about on these dialogs and I can walk you through it.
[~jloza] Notice how the "create keypair" and "import keypair" functions are to be served on a single page on the current UI.
[~kyolee] I will look but that should not be the case, that is not the design. They are separate functions.
[~kyolee] did you look at the wireframe? Where are we at with this?
[~kyolee] assigning this back to you. They should be two separate functions, just like before.

As mentioned a while ago, it doesn't make sense for the keypair landing page to contain 2 different buttons for the same operation, that is to create a new keypair.

By the layout of the landing page, it makes more sense if there exists one "create keypair" button, which takes to the new page, there the user has an option of whether to create a new keypair, or import a keypair, which can be handled by the separation of tabs.

Looks like these are the wireframes: https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Key+Pairs

[~kyolee] and [~jloza], where is the confusion? What are we doing here?
Yes, those are the wireframes. They show the content for the dialogs, the dialogs should be implemented int he 4.0 look and feel and arch, with that content, please. As two dialogs.
I updated the import wireframe to change the text from import key pair to import public key to be more accurate.

* Create key pair: you can use the code from create volume as a model to help you... blue area and title it contains should not be there
* create key pair: text wraps in the middle of the word "later"
Create: button text should say "Create and Download"
* import key: same comments about header and word wrapping, also labels wrap in the middle of words
* import key: got weird error when i tried to import a key i just created, under a different name: Internal Server Error

The server encountered an unexpected internal server error

(generated by waitress)

* import key: breadcrumb says Create key pair, should say Import public key
* Import: button text should just say Import

* create key pair: text should not be on the right (that is where help will be expanded), but should be above the form field
* same with import
* import label for contents, contents should be plural
I believe that it was [~kgill] who placed the text in the upper right corner.
[~kyolee] Sorry, confused that inline content with help text.  Feel free to move it back to the form.
